page.title: 20SEALED KNOT SOCIETY cont.
page.content:
The acquisition of a cannon barrel led to the building of a 12 pound muzzle loading cannon, designed by Peter Morton, of Oxhill, and constructed by David Fisher, Gerard Lewis and friends. The expertise of a military munitions manufacturer and an ex-guards officer, an expert on the Civil War, proved invaluable. This group met with Brigadier Peter Young at the Mitre Hotel, Oxford in 1969 when it was decided to recruit an army for Marston Moor.
From this group of six the{Sealed {Knot Society of Cavaliers}was born and has continued to re-enact Civil War battles and skirmishes until the present time. The Society now has 5,000 members divided into various regiments of cavalry and infantry.
